classes.name: Shooters
classes.description: Shooters are guns that fire small blobs of ink in quick succession. Most shooters continuously fire when the player holds the trigger, but some shooters offer semi-automatic or burst-fire functionality.

weapons.name: Sploosh-o-matic
weapons.description: A mid-damage, close-range shooter with a high fire rate. It features the highest damage output per second in its class, at the cost of having the shortest range.

weapons.name: Splattershot Jr.
weapons.description: The first weapon given to the player upon starting the game. It is a low-damage, close-range shooter with a high fire rate. Its fire rate and ink efficiency ensure that new players will be able to accomplish something.

weapons.name: Splash-o-matic
weapons.description: A low-damage, mid-range shooter with a high fire rate. It features perfect accuracy, the best among all automatic shooters.

weapons.name: Aerospray
weapons.description: A low-damage, close-range shooter with a high fire rate. It has the widest shot spread and the fastest firing rate in its class, allowing it to excel at covering turf.

weapons.name: Splattershot
weapons.description: A mid-damage, mid-range shooter with an average fire rate. It has no real weaknesses and can adapt to any situation.

weapons.name: .52 Gal
weapons.description: A high-damage, mid-range shooter with a slow fire rate. This weapon suffers from low accuracy.

weapons.name: N-ZAP
weapons.description: A low-damage, mid-range shooter with a fast fire rate. It has the fastest strafe speed in its class.

weapons.name: Splattershot Pro
weapons.description: A mid-damage, long-range shooter with a slow fire rate. Notably, this weapon has very high ink consumption.

weapons.name: .96 Gal
weapons.description: A high-damage, long-range shooter with a very slow fire rate. As a trade-off for its power and range, this weapon suffers from low accuracy, and it consumes more ink per shot than any other weapon in its class.

weapons.name: Jet Squelcher
weapons.description: A low-damage, long-range shooter with a slow fire rate. It has the longest range in its class.

weapons.name: Splattershot Nova
weapons.description: A low-damage, mid-range shooter with an average fire rate. It has good ink efficiency, but is in turn less accurate.

weapons.name: L-3 Nozzlenose
weapons.description: A low-damage, mid-range shooter. It is a burst fire weapon, firing three bullets after a pull of the trigger. Well-timed button presses are required to maintain an optimal fire rate.

weapons.name: H-3 Nozzlenose
weapons.description: A mid-damage, long-range shooter. It is burst-fire, firing three bullets after a pull of the trigger.

weapons.name: Squeezer
weapons.description: A shooter with two firing modes: semi-automatic and fully automatic. Pulling the trigger once will squirt out a single long range, mid-power shot with perfect accuracy. Holding the button leads to successive low range, high spread, lower-powered shots. The trigger can be tapped repeatedly to maintain the high-power mode.

classes.name: Rollers
classes.description: Rollers can be pushed along the ground, leaving a trail of ink. When performing an attack, a large amount of ink is flung from the roller. Damage is dealt if opponents come into contact with the weapon while it is being pushed, with most rollers being capable of crushing opponents in one hit. Rollers are capable of executing a thinner long-range vertical swing by swinging while in midair.

weapons.name: Carbon Roller
weapons.description: A light, mobile roller that has a fast rolling speed. It has extremely fast flicks in exchange for a short range. It is unable to crush opponents in one hit.

weapons.name: Splat Roller
weapons.description: The standard roller. It has decent range and mobility.

weapons.name: Dynamo Roller
weapons.description: A heavy roller. It deals high damage and can throw ink farther than all other rollers. However, it is very slow and consumes the most ink of any roller.

weapons.name: Flingza Roller
weapons.description: A roller that changes shape when performing a vertical swing. Its horizontal swing and rolling capabilities are similar to that of the Splat Roller, while its vertical swing is slow but has better range, inking, and damage.

weapons.name: Big Swig Roller
weapons.description: A roller with exceptional inking capabilities and wider range. It is extremely ink efficient and fast while rolling. Its swings are somewhat quick but tend to be weaker compared to other rollers. It cannot splat opponents with a single horizontal swing, and it cannot crush opponents in one hit.

classes.name: Chargers
classes.description: Chargers are sniper rifle-like mid- to long-range weapons that shoot extremely fast ink shots in a straight line. Chargers can instantly splat opponents once they are fully charged up (with some exceptions). While charging, a laser shows all players the direction in which the charger is being aimed. Some chargers allow the player to store their charge while swimming around in ink.

weapons.name: Squiffer
weapons.description: A short-range charger with a fast charge time that is unaffected while in mid-air.

weapons.name: Splat Charger
weapons.description: The standard charger, featuring a long range and a decent charge time.

weapons.name: Splatterscope
weapons.description: A Splat Charger with a scope, for extra range and precision at the cost of the inability to store charges.

weapons.name: E-liter
weapons.description: A charger with extreme range and damage in exchange for a slow charge time and heavy ink consumption.

weapons.name: E-liter Scope
weapons.description: An E-liter with a stronger scope than the Splatterscope, allowing for more range and extra precision. However, it cannot store its charge.

weapons.name: Bamboozler 14
weapons.description: A mid-range charger with an extremely fast charge time. However, its fully charged shots cannot splat opponents in a single hit. It also lacks the ability to store its charge and pierce targets.

weapons.name: Goo Tuber
weapons.description: A mid-range charger that can hold both full and partial charges for an exceptionally long time at the cost of a slow charge time. A single partially charged shot from this weapon can deal enough damage to splat an undamaged target on its own.

weapons.name: Snipewriter
weapons.description: A long-range charger that holds five, medium-damage shots per full charge, requiring two hits to splat an opponent. It lacks the ability to store its charge and pierce targets.

classes.name: Sloshers
classes.description: Sloshers are bucket-like weapons that hurl ink in an arc. The ink can be hurled over walls or obstacles. Some sloshers have unique projectiles, such as bubbles that bounce around or long-range projectiles which explode on impact.

weapons.name: Slosher
weapons.description: The standard slosher, with balanced performance. It can curve its sloshes to cover a wider area.

weapons.name: Tri-Slosher
weapons.description: A slosher that throws ink in three directions simultaneously. It has a high fire rate, but lower damage output and range.

weapons.name: Sloshing Machine
weapons.description: A slosher that launches a small mortar-like glob that is trailed by a vortex of ink. The vortex does splash damage in a small radius, while the glob itself does higher damage, with a smaller hitbox.

weapons.name: Bloblobber
weapons.description: A mid- to long-ranged slosher. Each swing lobs a volley of four, slow-moving "blobs" which bounce along the ground and reflect off of walls. It's the only slosher that can splat in one swing.

weapons.name: Explosher
weapons.description: A slosher that launches a slow, long-range projectile that explodes on impact with solid surfaces. It has high ink consumption and poor mobility, but in return has strong inking capabilities. Uniquely, the projectile and the explosion deal damage separately.

weapons.name: Dread Wringer
weapons.description: A slosher that sloshes two times in succession, allowing it to cover a wider area with a single swing, or focus one area for maximum damage. It has better range and inking capabilities than the standard Slosher, but at the cost of a lower fire rate.

classes.name: Splatlings
classes.description: Splatlings are rotary cannon- or minigun-like weapons that generally have a high rate of fire and considerable range. They operate similar to chargers but release a stream of small ink bullets instead of a single powerful shot. Like chargers, a full charge is necessary to achieve maximum potential range and firing duration.

weapons.name: Mini Splatling
weapons.description: A light splatling with a short charge time but shorter range. It allows users to strafe quickly while charging and firing.

weapons.name: Heavy Splatling
weapons.description: The standard splatling. Its stats are well-rounded, having no glaring strengths or weaknesses.

weapons.name: Hydra Splatling
weapons.description: The Splatling with the longest range in its class. It can fire continuously for a lengthy period of time, with the drawback being its ink hunger and high charge time. When fully charged, a high-damage feature activates, allowing users to splat opponents with three hits.

weapons.name: Ballpoint Splatling
weapons.description: A Splatling with two different firing modes, an initial short ranged firing mode with a high fire rate and a secondary firing mode that has a slower fire rate but longer range and perfect accuracy. Unlike most other splatlings, it can interrupt its fire to recharge. Upon completing a full charge, subsequent charges will retain the secondary mode attributes until the charge is entirely expended.

weapons.name: Nautilus
weapons.description: A shorter ranged Splatling with a medium charge rate. The weapon boasts the ability to store its charge much like some chargers and can interrupt its fire to recharge. Its accuracy in the air is comparable to its accuracy when grounded.

weapons.name: Heavy Edit Splatling
weapons.description: A Splatling with a slow charge time, but a very high fire rate when fully charged.

classes.name: Dualies
classes.description: Dualies are paired sets of guns that give their user the ability to dodge roll. After a dodge roll, the two dualies are held together, enhancing their performance in various ways depending on the dualies.

weapons.name: Dapple Dualies
weapons.description: Lightweight dualies that have quick dodge rolls, a high fire rate, and middling damage. However, they have poor range, and their dodge rolls only cover a short distance.

weapons.name: Splat Dualies
weapons.description: The first available pair of dualies in the Splatoon weapons. They feature balanced performance, having a high fire rate to compensate for the low damage typical of the class.

weapons.name: Glooga Dualies
weapons.description: A mid-range, mid-damage pair of dualies with a low fire rate. Their dodge rolls are slow, but shot damage and range increase after a dodge roll instead of fire rate, allowing it to splat opponents with one fewer shot at greater distances.

weapons.name: Dualie Squelchers
weapons.description: A long-range pair of dualies with unique dodge rolls. The dodge rolls are quick and allow the user to slide instead of being locked in place, but they do not increase their fire rate.

weapons.name: Tetra Dualies
weapons.description: These mid-range dualies put a significant emphasis on mobility. They allow up to four consecutive dodge rolls instead of the normal two, and can also shoot while rolling.

weapons.name: Douser Dualies FF
weapons.description: A long-range pair of Dualies that can only perform one dodge roll. When performing a dodge roll, the fire rate increases while reducing their range.

classes.name: Brellas
classes.description: Brellas are shotgun-like weapons with deployable shields which have large amounts of HP that can be held in front of the user. Most brellas can also launch their shield forward.

weapons.name: Splat Brella
weapons.description: The standard Brella, featuring middling range, damage, and shield durability.

weapons.name: Tenta Brella
weapons.description: A heavier brella with a larger, more durable shield. Its shots have more range and it is able to deal lethal damage in one shot, at the cost of a slow rate of fire.

weapons.name: Undercover Brella
weapons.description: A lightweight brella that can be fired while its shield is open. It has a quick rate of fire, but the damage dealt by each shot is low and its shield is particularly weak. It is unable to launch its shield.

weapons.name: Recycled Brella 24 Mk I
weapons.description: A Brella with faster shield deployment and recovery.

classes.name: Blasters
classes.description: Blasters are weapons that fire large globs of ink with a delayed explosion, which have a spherical hitbox and are capable of hitting opponents that are behind walls or cover.

weapons.name: Luna Blaster
weapons.description: A blaster with short range but above average fire rate, blast radius, and ink efficiency. It is capable of splatting an opponent with one direct hit.

weapons.name: Blaster
weapons.description: The standard blaster. Has a slow firing speed but is well-rounded otherwise.

weapons.name: Range Blaster
weapons.description: A revised version of the Blaster that boasts higher range at the cost of a slower fire rate.

weapons.name: Clash Blaster
weapons.description: A blaster that fires huge short-ranged blasts in very quick succession, but its low damage makes it hard to splat opponents with it.

weapons.name: Rapid Blaster
weapons.description: A blaster that fires long range blasts at a good fire rate, with reduced damage and blast radius.

weapons.name: Rapid Blaster Pro
weapons.description: This modified version of the Rapid Blaster can hit at even longer ranges, but has a slower fire rate, and uses more ink per shot.

weapons.name: S-BLAST
weapons.description: A slow-firing, one-shot capable blaster with two firing modes, short-range and long-range. The short-range mode is triggered by pressing ZR after jumping, and fires a huge short-ranged blast. The long-range mode is triggered by pressing ZR on the ground, and fires a long-ranged, high-velocity shot with a small blast radius.

classes.name: Brushes
classes.description: Brushes can be pushed along the ground, much like rollers. They are especially fast but leave a narrow trail of ink. They do not deal nearly as much contact damage, and no brush is capable of crushing opponents in one hit. However, instead of flinging large waves of ink, brushes quickly swipe from side to side, flicking many smaller globs.

weapons.name: Inkbrush
weapons.description: A fast but short-ranged brush. When pushed along the ground, the user moves at extremely high speed, and leaves behind a narrow trail of ink.

weapons.name: Octobrush
weapons.description: A slower brush with decent range. Movement speed while sliding along the ground is a bit slower compared to the Inkbrush.

weapons.name: Painbrush
weapons.description: An even slower brush that must wind up before it can start swinging. In return, it has greater range, power, and inking capabilities.

classes.name: Stringers
classes.description: Stringers are bow-like weapons that generally have considerable range and middling damage. Like chargers, a full charge is necessary to achieve maximum range and damage. They have vertical and horizontal shots, similar to rollers. They shoot three strings of ink per shot.

weapons.name: Tri-Stringer
weapons.description: The standard stringer, with long range but no charge hold. Reaching the first level of charge allows its shots to lodge themselves in terrain briefly before exploding.

weapons.name: REEF-LUX 450
weapons.description: A lightweight stringer that can store its charge, but cannot fire explosive shots. It charges quickly and does more damage than the Tri-Stringer, but it is lacking in range.

weapons.name: Wellstring V
weapons.description: A stringer with five explosive shots.

classes.name: Splatanas
classes.description: Splatanas are sword-like weapons that are similar to brushes, without the rolling function. Instead, when ZR is held, they will charge a more powerful vertical swing. All splatanas have an additional melee hitbox as the splatana itself, and when charged, this hitbox can splat opponents in one hit.

weapons.name: Splatana Stamper
weapons.description: The standard stringer, with long range but no charge hold. Reaching the first level of charge allows its shots to lodge themselves in terrain briefly before exploding.

weapons.name: Splatana Wiper
weapons.description: The standard Splatana, with decent range but low damage. It moves quickly when slashing and charging, and has good ink efficiency.

weapons.name: Decavitator
weapons.description: A splatana with a long-ranged horizontal lunging attack, which can be redirected while mid-lunge.
